channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024080610
item.description:
Report X-2024080610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A wet hazmat package was discovered in unload and the package was placed in a plastic lined hazmat tote and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection the package determined to be damaged. All the proper hazmat procedures were followed. Proper hazmat loading processes should always be followed when building trailers.

item.title: Report E-2024080211
item.description:
Report E-2024080211

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 31, 2024, at 2226 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Byron Center, Michigan regarding the release of Ammonium Nitrate (UN1477 Ammonium Nitrate, Potassium Nitrate, 5.1, II). Terminal personnel reported that 1 ounce was released from (1) 10lb plastic bag due to a forklift puncture and impacted the dock floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release and staged the 5 gallon DF of waste onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024080622
item.description:
Report X-2024080622

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO VISIBLE FROST FORMING ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS SURROUNDING A STYROFOAM COOLER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE OUTER BOX HAS AN OLD FEDEX GROUND TRACKING LABEL STILL APPLIED.

item.title: Report X-2024080036
item.description:
Report X-2024080036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found wet on the outside of the box. Proper PPE was used to inspect the package. Upon inspection it was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose cap which led to the leak. The package was then placed in a hazmat bin. There was no inner packaging inside the box which likely helped contribute to the spill.
